The claim stated that fines of up to SGD: 150 would be imposed for not wearing masks during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The Singaporean government announced fin: 1,000 for not wearing a face mask in public on April 14, 2020.
Singapore: s Minister for National Development, Lawrence Wong, confirmed that fines had been issued under the new restrictions, with 500 fines already issued at the time of his statement.
